text: <!channel> calling all coffee mugs and glasses - come back to the kitchen :slightly_smiling_face:
if not in use, that is.
we have a bunch in our meeting room - sorry!
(in use)
I'm thinking about testing out a slackbot that provides summaries of channels to users, should they decide they want one.  Two that I've found:  <http://www.thepaperbot.io/>
and <https://slackdigest.com/digest.html>

attachments.title: SlackDigest | Daily digest for Slack channel conversations
attachments.fallback: SlackDigest | Daily digest for Slack channel conversations

text: sounds interesting
does anyone feel that either of these might pose a threat to our information security?
i read the privacy policy for both and they say they don't sell our info etc but i'd like to get other eyes on it before taking action
another option is creating our own, but i kinda want to see how these work first
this is a result of a discussion from diversity_inclusion - we felt that it might be helpful to have a takeaway from all these discussions
Both seem fine from my eyes. I'd start with one ? Paper bot appears to be focused on link sharing so depends on what we need
i'll start with the digest one since it seems most comprehensive... curious to see if it does actual contextual analysis
focus on a non project channel first, info sec is a totally valid concern and we have massive financial risk with involuntary disclosure of confidential information.
test it in <#C035ZHX78|shutup>
evans told me he wanted you to create a unique channel for this and invite him
sorry about the internet outage earlier. comcast modem went down for a few minutes :/
any concerns with integrating slackbots we built ourselves?
<@U02HAJ6JF> not particularly, the question of 3rd parties ingesting data with unknown SLA on data security is a good one tho.
we have some obligations to our cyber insurance policy.
remember to close the windows tonight. it's supposed to rain
<!here|@here> ^
getting the North room now
thanks joel!
Sure thing. Had good help. :)
